question: Lettering in cities is an increasing problem which needs to be dealt with some people think that steeper fines is a best way to deal with this problem to what extent do you agree
text: To begin with, as we know well painting or lettering is the product of art, but, painting without permission can destroy people's assets and be illegal. A higher penalty can stop them from creating a dirty place, but, this statement did not solve the root cause of the problem, hence, I somewhat agree with those statements. The higher fines the higher fear, the majority can acknowledge this logic because it was implemented in other regulations in many countries, for example, the regulation to charge with a maximum penalty when drunk people driving. Finally, the most important factor that can help prevent this issue is nurture.
